key_points: Four of the 13 service members killed in the Kabul airport bombing were from California.
The suicide bombing occurred during the evacuation process amid the Taliban takeover, killing 169 Afghans and 13 U.S. service members.
The California victims were identified as Sgt. Nicole Gee, Lance Cpl. Dylan Merola, Cpl. Hunter Lopez, and Lance Cpl. Kareem Mae'Lee Grant Nikoui.
Sgt. Nicole Gee was a maintenance technician and posted a photo on Instagram a week before her death showing her love for her job.
Lance Cpl. Kareem Nikoui, a graduate from Norco High School, will be honored on the 'Lest We Forget Wall' at the George A. Ingalls Veterans Memorial Plaza.
Cpl. Hunter Lopez was the son of Riverside Deputy Sheriff Alicia Lopez and Riverside Sheriff's Captain Herman Lopez, and planned to become a Riverside County Sheriff's Deputy.
Lance Cpl. Dylan R. Merola was from Rancho Cucamonga and a GoFundMe has been set up in his honor.
Gov. Gavin Newsom praised the troops' heroism and offered condolences, standing with the Afghan American community during this difficult time.
The bombing was blamed on Afghanistanâ€™s offshoot of the Islamic State group, making it one of the deadliest days in the Afghan war.
It was the most lethal day for American forces in Afghanistan since 2011, with the death toll possibly changing as investigations continue.
